meanings.definition: A type of basket or container used for holding fruit or flowers.
meanings.sent1: The florist arranged the colorful flowers in the corbeils for the wedding centerpiece.
meanings.sent2: The farmer picked ripe apples and placed them in the corbeils to take to the market.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten jumped into the corbeils and knocked all the fruit onto the floor.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was styled in a way that resembled a corbeils overflowing with flowers.
meanings.sent5: The image of the overflowing corbeils filled with fresh strawberries stayed in her mind.

meanings.definition: A decorative architectural element resembling a basket or container.
meanings.sent1: The intricate design of the building's facade included beautiful corbeils under the windows.
meanings.sent2: The ancient temple was adorned with stone corbeils that added elegance to its structure.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the corbeils on the building were magical portals to another world.
meanings.sent4: The shadows cast by the corbeils created a mesmerizing pattern on the ground.
meanings.sent5: The artist sketched the unique corbeils of the cathedral to capture their beauty.

meanings.definition: A type of French pastry made with puff pastry and filled with cream or fruit.
meanings.sent1: The bakery displayed a variety of delicious corbeils in the pastry case.
meanings.sent2: She savored the sweet taste of the corbeils filled with vanilla custard.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully shaped the dough into tiny corbeils before baking them.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of freshly baked corbeils filled the kitchen with a tempting scent.
meanings.sent5: The golden crust of the corbeils glistened under the bakery lights.
